column4: does no scripts only try to block scripts it considers dangerous?
I installed and things like gmail work fine
starnestommy: yeah I just looked at the little noscripts icon, its definitely preventing stuff...
while im here, i tried installing the artwiz fonts but they don't appear in my font options.  Has anyone seen this?
dpkg -L <artwiz_fonts_package> ... where did it put them?
/usr/share/fonts/X11/misc
That should be fine... try 'sudo update-fonts-dir' and see if they show up.
i assume on that dir that i posted earlier?
just run it.
no arguments necessary.
hmm, ok then yes... my bad
a warning about an absolute path and no other output
did you use '/usr/share/fonts/X11/misc' expicitely?
affirmative
Hmm, ok, then lets see if they're showing up... they should be there now....
If not, log out and back in, and they'll be there I'd bet
negative, at least from the appearance gnome dealy
Ill ask my other questions before trying the logout: 1) I have 1.7 ghz machine and it takes ~6 seconds for the gnome file browser to fire up.  Is that normal? 2)  Is it safe to go to HH from GG yet?
That upgrade will probably fix the slow startup ... I'm not sure how safe it is but there have been many updates already (around 50 or so?)
50 updates from 7.10 to 8.04?!!??
nah... since 8.04 was released... from 7.10 -> 8.04 there will be like 500
only 500 people have upgrade to hardy?  I would have thought 1000x that
No... that is # of packages upgraded....
oooohhhhh
